results.adx_keywords: Auctions;Art;Sculpture;Collectors and Collections;Philanthropy;Allen, Paul G;Christie's;Microsoft Corp
results.title: Paul G. Allen’s Art at Christie’s Tops $1.5 Billion, Cracking Records
results.abstract: A museum’s worth of masterworks from the Microsoft co-founder’s collection are offered in a two-part charity sale. Five topped $100 million.

media.caption: Georges Seurat’s “Les Poseuses Ensemble (Petite version)” (1888) being auctioned during the Paul Allen sale at Christie’s in New York on Wednesday. The sale realized $1 billion with fees at about 8:30 p.m.
media.copyright: Jeenah Moon for The New York Times

results.title: Antidepressants Don’t Work the Way Many People Think
results.abstract: The most commonly prescribed medications for depression are somewhat effective — but not because they correct a “chemical imbalance.”

media.copyright: Getty Images

results.adx_keywords: Computers and the Internet;Hiring and Promotion;Layoffs and Job Reductions;Labor and Jobs;Start-ups;Recession and Depression;Unemployment;Careers and Professions;Meta Platforms Inc;Twitter;Silicon Valley (Calif)
results.title: Tech’s Talent Wars Have Come Back to Bite It
results.abstract: Hiring the best, the brightest and the highest number of employees was a badge of honor at tech companies. Not anymore as layoffs surge.

media.copyright: Antonio Sortino

results.adx_keywords: Deaths (Obituaries);Art;Sculpture;Women and Girls;Nineteen Hundred Sixties;Bontecou, Lee;Castelli Gallery (Manhattan, NY);Lincoln Center for the Performing Arts
results.title: Lee Bontecou, Acclaimed Creator of Unusual Sculptures, Dies at 91
results.abstract: Her use of what one critic called “a three-dimensional form that was neither painting nor sculpture” earned the kind of praise typically reserved in the 1960s for male art stars.
org_facet: Lincoln Center for the Performing Arts

media.caption: The artist Lee Bontecou with one of her sculptures at the Leo Castelli Gallery in Manhattan in 1966. She was one of the first women whose work was shown there.
media.copyright: Fred W. McDarrah/MUUS Collection, via Getty Images

results.title: Las barreras humanas que afectan la migración animal
results.abstract: Debido a la presencia humana, los animales se mueven mucho menos, lo que puede afectar su capacidad de encontrar comida y pone en mayor riesgo a especies en peligro, según un nuevo campo de estudio llamado “ecología del movimiento”.

media.caption: Antílopes americanos o berrendos tras una barda al noroeste de Casper, Wyoming. Un estudio ha encontrado que los animales silvestres se mueven mucho menos en regiones con presencia humana.
media.copyright: Alan Rogers/Casper Star-Tribune, vía Associated Press

results.title: Putin Can’t Escape History
results.abstract: Putin has responded to setbacks by demanding ever more sacrifice from the Russians for an ever crueler war.

media.caption: The Victory museum in Moscow.

results.title: If Dogs Played Wordle
results.abstract: Dogs like to do what we do. So it’s only a matter of time, right?

media.copyright: Jenna Kim/The New York Times

results.byline: By Katie Glueck and Ruth Igielnik
results.title: Unwilling to Hold Their Nose and Vote, Ticket-Splitters Make Their Mark
results.abstract: Some midterm voters seemed more inclined to support candidates of different parties this year, emphasizing contender quality over partisan identity.

media.caption: Voters in Cobb County, Ga., on Tuesday. In Georgia, there was a sizable gap in support for Gov. Brian Kemp and Herschel Walker, the Republicans’ Senate nominee.
media.copyright: Gabriela Bhaskar for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Virtual Currency;High Net Worth Individuals;Mergers, Acquisitions and Divestitures;Regulation and Deregulation of Industry;Computers and the Internet;Social Media;Bankman-Fried, Sam;Zhao, Changpeng;Binance;HK FTX Trading Ltd (Futures Exchange)
results.title: Binance Pulls Out of Deal to Acquire Rival Crypto Exchange FTX
results.abstract: The rapid collapse of FTX, built by the billionaire Sam Bankman-Fried, suggests that no company in the freewheeling, loosely regulated crypto industry is safe.

media.caption: Sam Bankman-Fried, the head of FTX, was seen as one of the most reliable leaders of the crypto industry.
media.copyright: Lam Yik Fei for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Russian Invasion of Ukraine (2022);Peace Process;International Relations;Modi, Narendra;Jaishankar, Subrahmanyam;India;Russia;Ukraine
results.byline: By Jeffrey Gettleman and Mujib Mashal
results.title: Could India Help Broker Peace in Ukraine?
results.abstract: India has good relations with both Russia and the West, and seeks a more muscular role in geopolitics. The biggest obstacle is that Ukrainians and Russians don’t want to talk.

media.caption: S. Jaishankar, India’s foreign minister, is traveling to Russia this week for meetings with Russian officials.
media.copyright: Kevin Dietsch/Getty Images

results.adx_keywords: Travel and Vacations;Endangered and Extinct Species;Jaguars;Conservation of Resources;Yucatan Peninsula (Mexico)
results.title: The Return of the Jaguar
results.abstract: Thanks to Mexican conservation efforts, the jaguar is making a comeback in the Yucatán Peninsula. A traveler ventures into its habitat in the tropical jungles surrounding an ancient Maya city.

media.caption: The number of jaguars is growing in Mexico, especially in areas of the Yucatán Peninsula.
media.copyright: Patryk_Kosmider/Getty Images

results.adx_keywords: Immigration and Emigration;Refugees and Displaced Persons;Asylum, Right of;Illegal Immigration;Children and Childhood;United States Politics and Government;Darien Gap;Colombia;Panama;Venezuela
results.byline: By Julie Turkewitz and Federico Rios
results.title: A Girl Loses Her Mother in the Jungle, and a Migrant Dream Dies
results.abstract: The pandemic, climate change and growing conflict are forcing a seismic shift in global migration. In few places is that more clear than a perilous crossing called the Darién Gap.

media.caption: Sarah Cuauro while traveling through the Darién, one of the world’s most dangerous migrant corridors, in an attempt to reach the United States.
media.copyright: Federico Rios for The New York Times

results.title: His Roman Holiday Lasted a Lifetime
results.abstract: “Just Passing Through” collects the diaries and photographs of Milton Gendel, who lived large, bought plenty and schmoozed with the glamorous.

media.caption: A 1968 Milton Gendel photograph of Princess Margaret at Villa Reale, included in the new book “Just Passing Through.”
media.copyright: Milton Gendel

results.title: Gal Costa, Singer Who Embodied Tropicália’s Innovative Spirit, Dies at 77
results.abstract: Her graceful, flexible voice and ear for memorable songs sustained a five-decade career defining the sound of Brazilian pop.

media.caption: Gal Costa in 1996. Her recording career spanned more than 50 years and three dozen albums.
media.copyright: Lionel Flusin/Gamma-Rapho, via Getty Images

results.title: Melatonin Isn’t a Sleeping Pill. Here’s How to Use It.
results.abstract: The “vampire hormone” can act like a dose of sunset, tricking your body into feeling like it’s time to sleep.

results.title: Title IX at 50: How it Changed Congress, Campuses and Sports
results.abstract: The New-York Historical Society looks back on the landmark gender equality legislation and how it transformed women’s access to education, sports and more.

media.caption: Representative Shirley Chisholm of New York, center left, and the Title IX advocate Margaret Dunkle, leading a 1975 celebration to mark the third anniversary of the bill’s passage.

results.title: TikTok Seen Moving Toward U.S. Security Deal, but Hurdles Remain
results.abstract: A draft agreement with the Biden administration to keep the Chinese-owned video app operating in the United States is under review. That could mean more wrangling.
org_facet: Committee on Foreign Investment in the United States (CFIUS)

media.caption: TikTok has been under a legal cloud in the United States because of its Chinese ownership.
